attributes.text: A widget with a progress bar and an optional log for messages.
Fired on change of the property {@link #logContent}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #newLogText}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #okButtonText}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #progress}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #showLog}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #showProgressBar}.
Adds new text to the log
Apply the OK Button text
Applies the ‘progress’ property
Applies the ‘show’ property
Create the content of the dialog. Extending classes must implement this method.
Handle click on cancel button. Calls callback with an “undefined” argument

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property hideWhenCancelled with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Whether to hide the widget when the cancel button is clicked (default: true)
Whether to hide the widget when the progress is at 100% (default:true)
The content of the log
New text that should be written to the log
The text of the OK button. If null, hide the button. (default: null)
The percentage of the progress, 0-100
Whether or not the log is visible (default: false)
Whether or not the progress bar is visible (default: true)
